node.title: Changes to Victoria's COVID-19 rules are about to come into effect. Here's what you need to know
node.alt: People walking across Bourke Street Mall in Melbourne with Christmas decorations above.
node.description: Omicron is looming, but some rules about mask-wearing and showing your vaccination status will be relaxed at 11:59pm tonight. In the meantime, authorities say, they are carefully monitoring the new variant.
node.content:
["Take note\u00a0Victorians\u00a0because, once again, changes to COVID-19 restrictions relating to mask-wearing and proof-of-vaccination status\u00a0are about to come into effect.", "The\u00a0swath\u00a0of changes will take effect from 11:59pm tonight, but some of them have been tempered by increasing\u00a0concern over the spread of the Omicron variant.", "More than 700 people have been told to get tested and isolate after a confirmed Omicron case spent hours at two Melbourne venues, and health authorities say they expect the number of Omicron cases to continue to rise.", "The changes coming into effect late this evening, which will be signed off under the new pandemic bill,\u00a0will remain in place until January 12 next year.", "
How are vaccination rules changing?
", "People aged under 18\u00a0will no longer have to show their vaccination status to get into any venues.", "Mandatory vaccination rules will also ease in most retail settings, meaning people will no longer have to present proof of being fully vaccinated against COVID-19.", "Proof of vaccination will also be dropped as a requirement in settings such as real estate, places of worship, weddings and funerals.", "If funerals and weddings are held at a place of worship, vaccination requirements won't apply, but if they're held in a hospitality setting, then the need for\u00a0proof of vaccination will still apply.", "Hair and beauty services are the exception, and a proof of vaccination will still be required there.", "Hospitality settings \u2014 such as restaurants, cafes, bars and pubs \u2014 remain the same, and proof of two COVID-19 jabs or, in rare cases, an exemption,\u00a0will still be needed.", "", "
Under the changed rules, proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 will still be required in hospitality settings.(ABC News: Kimberley Bernard)
", "
Where are masks still required?
", "Workers will still need to wear masks in hospitality settings, and both workers and customers will still need to wear masks in all retail settings.", "There are other settings where masks still need to be worn, including when visiting a hospital, catching public transport and for workers at abattoir, meat, seafood and poultry processing sites.", "Under the state's roadmap, the requirement for masks in retail settings was scheduled to be dropped in mid-December, but Victorian Health Minister Martin Foley said Omicron had\u00a0\"changed the landscape\".", "It's important to remember that authorities, and public health experts, say that, just because masks are not\u00a0required, it doesn't mean that you should not\u00a0wear one in order to provide yourself with an extra layer of protection.", "It's recommended that you continue to carry a mask with you and wear it situations such as\u00a0being indoors in a public setting and if you are\u00a0somewhere that does not\u00a0allow social distancing.", "", "
Masks will still be required on public transport in Victoria until at least January 12, 2022.(ABC News: Kyle Harley)
", "
Some other changes are also being made
", "Other changes that will come into effect at 11:59pm tonight are enabling regional and rural areas to schedule more elective surgery procedures and changing cleaning requirements.", "Elective surgery in country areas will be able to ramp up to 75 per cent of the health services' usual capacity.", "In recognition of the increased understanding that COVID-19 poses a greater risk through airborne spread than through surfaces, workplaces exposed to the virus will no longer have to undergo a deep clean.", "In other settings \u2014 such as gyms, tour and transport operators and creative arts venues such as theatres and cinemas \u2014\u00a0equipment will no longer need to be cleaned between each use.", "", "
Some cleaning requirements will be relaxed as part of the changes.(ABC News: Michael Clements)
", "
What is known about Omicron's spread in Victoria?
", "Victoria's Chief Health Officer Brett Sutton highlighted the concern about Omicron's spread, and said the global story of the variant was likely to be replicated in the state.", "\"I think we'll see a significant increase in our Omicron cases [because]\u00a0the story, globally, is that it's doubling every two to three days,\" he said.", "\"It's gone from a few hundred cases in South Africa to tens of thousands in a matter of a few weeks, wherever it's seeded into Europe it's gone from small numbers to hundreds and thousands of cases in a relatively short period of time.", "\"It's replacing the Delta variant. I think that's going to happen globally but we'll continue to watch that.\"", "So far, 10 cases of the variant have been confirmed in Victoria.", "Professor Sutton said he was concerned about the possibility of\u00a0Omicron exposures at Melbourne venues last Friday night potentially being superspreader events, but emphasised\u00a0it was still \"very early days\".", "He urged anyone who had not yet been vaccinated to do so, and for those eligible for boosters to book in and get them as soon as possible.", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
